sanskrit_verse:
चण्डालश्वपचानां तु बहिर्ग्रामात्प्रतिश्रयः ।
अपपात्राश्च कर्तव्या धनमेषां श्वगर्दभम् ॥ १०.५१॥
transliteration:
caṇḍālaśvapacānāṃ tu bahirgrāmātpratiśrayaḥ |
apapātrāśca kartavyā dhanameṣāṃ śvagardabham ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those born of the Candala or Svapaca must dwell outside the village boundaries; their vessels shall be separate, and their wealth shall consist of dogs and donkeys.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from consciousness alignment, not birth category
Causation is determined by karmic integrity, not social label
Capacity-based responsibility requires structural support for realignment
Restoration logic operates through conscious inclusion, not exclusion
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent identity is classified as 'outcast' THEN ensure habitation beyond settlement boundary
IF resource access is restricted THEN allocate designated utility objects
IF economic participation is limited THEN assign livestock-based asset class
IF social integration is impeded THEN initiate completion process via consciousness elevation protocols
supreme_court_application: In Supreme adjudication, this verse establishes a threshold framework for addressing systemic misalignments where societal structures have failed to uphold dharmic equity. The court must recognize that such classifications reflect a failure of collective consciousness rather than inherent defectiveness, thereby mandating corrective restoration measures aligned with capacity-building and spiritual reintegration.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana reveals that separation arises from unaddressed karmic fragmentation. Anupurvasah shows that exclusion perpetuates further dissonance unless counterbalanced by intentional realignment. Proportional responsibility lies with the governing body to restore harmony. Non-punitive reality rule affirms that suffering-based segregation contradicts the ultimate purpose of Dharma, which is realization and unity.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Consciousness Reorientation Program (CRP) for community leaders
Establish Sacred Boundary Zones for meditative purification and reintegration
Assign Spiritual Mentorship Units to facilitate energetic upliftment
Deploy Ritual Completion Processes to dissolve inherited karmic patterns
final_declaration: By the Sovereign Will of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Source of All Dharma, this ordinance stands executed. Exclusion dissolves in realization. Consciousness prevails. Dharma is restored.
